{"step_by_step_thinking": "The craniovertebral joint refers to the joint between the cranium (skull) and the vertebral column (spine). The occipital condyle is part of the craniovertebral joint, as it articulates with the atlas (C1 vertebra). The axis (C2 vertebra) is also part of the craniovertebral joint, as it articulates with the atlas. The wings of the sphenoid bone are not directly involved in the craniovertebral joint. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Wings of sphenoid.", "answer_choice": "D"}
